reviews.review_msg: He, as a person, is miserable. When you ask questions, you get belittled. When you don't ask questions, he yells at you for not participating. When you do poorly on tests, he gets very angry and treats you worse. By the end of the semester he was telling us he hated teaching us and he hated being a prof at SFU. For the love of GOD, avoid this prof.

He is just amazing. I failed Ochem the first time I took it cause I didn't want to go to the lecture cause the topics are so dry. Nabyl makes the class engaging and bearable. Go to class regularly, attend tutorials, practice on your own, and go to his office hours if you have questions and you should do just fine!

He doesn't even deserve a 1. He's worse than that. He is the worst professor at SFU. He is rude, disrespectful, and never takes responsibility. Blames people for technical difficulties. Do yourself a favor and do not take the course with him.
Rude, ignoring, non-accommodating, impatient, complains about doing his job. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS. I am not a complainer and the way this class was run is below any sort of critique
The best prof I've ever had. :D I LOVE O-Chem now.

One of the best profs I have ever had! Super engaging and funny, he's willing to repeat and go over any concepts that the class did not understand. Labs and exams were straight forward and fair. Final was a little bit harder. His office hours were insightful, make sure to use them to your advantage! Overall, he was funny and awesome!

Easily the best professor I've ever had at SFU. If you're  still a little boy, Nabyl will push you to become a man. I was initially intimidated and hated being called out in class, but it definitely shaped me to become a much stronger individual and student. In addition, he's phenomenal at teaching and drops valuable life lessons. U the real MVP
A mass of muscle and intellect
He is very rude and inconsiderate and does not help at all. Dont take any class with him he is the worst!!! I got an A in the class by learning everything on my own but most people did horrible

AMAZING ORGANIC CHEM TEACHER! He is the best teacher I have had so far at SFU. He is very straight forward and tells you exactly what you NEED to know for the exam! He likes to joke with students so he may call you out and seem intimidating, but he is actually very approachable if you have a genuine want to succeed in his course.

Nabyl is the best professor I've had at SFU so far.  He teaches well and makes sure to convey EXACTLY what is going to be expected from you on exams.  Go to your tutorials and don't fall behind on the course material, he might randomly question students during lecture and labs.  Might seem intimidating but he's very approachable.
